From time to time, we come to this point and not being able to overcome these difficulty is the major reason why research on the Shroud remains amateur and not professional. This applies to Barrie but also to all the persons who along the years have had access to any kind of sample coming from the Shroud. If any available material is not freely available for research to anyone, with a clear protocol of use, sorry to tell, but we will never progress. In this sense, the research on the Shroud is stuck for so many years because in the absence of a central body coordinating available evidences AND designing a comprehensive research program with state of the art techniques and knowledge, we are still discussing on material published in the 90’s and techniques like C14 belonging to the same period. Please remember what has happened with other recent examples in which truly scientific challenges that additionally may have serious social/religious/political implications.Take for example, the long period in which Qumram manuscripts or climate data were not available to the scientific community. In both cases, research did not move forward until open discussion on objective data allowed properly addressing those scientific issues.
In my view, with the Shroud we are stuck exactly for the same reason.

I don’t think a valid or good point has been made here, Ron.  I find it childish.  Here’s my answer to you and anyone else…
If you want to do research and would like Barrie’s pictures to do that research, visit Shroud.com and e-mail him and request whatever pictures you would like to use to do your research.  That is precisely what I did and he has been most generous.  Perhaps you ought to read Barrie’s response posted in Dan’s blog elsewhere.
The real problem is that not everyone will honor these legal and rightful copyrights.  Barrie has extensive experience with this area since he was a professional photographer for about 40 years and also taught copyright law in a school in California.  In this area he is an expert.  This is like telling John Jackson how to do physics or Ray Rogers, God rest his soul, how to do chemistry.
